instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .

threads.title: 00165 short on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
F7140 Blown,
0V diode red to ground at pin 2 F7140
Nothing visiblly wrong in components with connection points to pin 2 of F7140. I assume because its a direct short it would be ok to apply voltage? If so, how much?

threads.title: 00165 short on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Why assume, instead of checking if no short on the big coils???
Compare the exact ohm value with the coils from all secondary power supplies.

threads.title: 00165 short on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
The closest I can find is L7310/20 are both 16.2 ohms to ground or .019V drop diode mode.
Pin 2 F7140 is .1 ohms to ground and 0.002V diode

threads.title: 00165 short on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message: Put fuse back and used freeze spray to find bubbling at <CAPACITOR>C7314</CAPACITOR>. Replaced and boots!
